dcterms:creator: P. Dollar
C. Wojek
B. Schiele
P. Perona
dcterms:description: The Caltech dataset is one of the most popular datasets for pedestrian detection, containing 250k frames extracted from 10 hours of urban traffic video, with a total of 350k annotated bounding boxes for 2300 unique pedestrians.
dcterms:title: Caltech pedestrian dataset

dcterms:creator: A. Geiger
P. Lenz
R. Urtasun
dcterms:description: The KITTI dataset consists of 7481 training images and 7518 test images, with over 80,000 annotated objects in traffic scenes, providing a diverse set of pedestrians with varying sizes, viewpoints, occlusions, and truncations.
dcterms:title: KITTI pedestrian dataset

dcterms:creator: M. Cordts
M. Omran
S. Ramos
T. Scharw√§chter
M. Enzweiler
R. Benenson
U. Franke
S. Roth
B. Schiele
dcterms:description: The Cityscapes dataset contains dense pixel annotations of 19 semantic classes, including road, building, car, pedestrian, and sky, and is used for training models in semantic segmentation.
dcterms:title: Cityscapes dataset
